value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. In this video, I'll explain some functions in DAX that you can use to do this calculation. Most of these functions can be used inside a measure

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: How to Reduce the Size of Power BI file in a few Steps
value.excerpt: One of the performance considerations of a Power BI file is to reduce the size of it as much as possible. value.title: Power BI HR Pattern   DAX Measures for the Last Position to Date   Last Status to Date
value.excerpt: One of the common patterns in Power BI is to have a table with different statuses throughout time and then wanting to get the latest status up to a selected date. A simple example of that is to have a table with position(role) changes of employees and then wanting to see their latest position based on

value.title: Power BI User Access Levels   Build and Edit are different
value.excerpt: Often I have seen Power BI users have access to the areas that they shouldn’t. In Power BI, you can share a report with a user just for view only, or give them access to view and built, or to Edit. These are all different levels of access. Build access is the one that is often is confused with Edit.
